question_text: Which of the following are true of microATX form factor motherboards? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: They support the same mounting points as ATX
They are always incompatible with ATX cases
They typically support fewer PCIe slots than ATX
They allow use in compact builds
correct_answer: They support the same mounting points as ATX
They typically support fewer PCIe slots than ATX
They allow use in compact builds
explanation: microATX shares mounting hole locations with ATX and is often used in compact builds but has fewer expansion slots.
